tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE EditorialCalendars (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    story_title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    author VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    publish_date DATE NOT NULL,
    deadline DATE
);

CREATE TABLE AssignmentSchedules (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    assignment_date DATE NOT NULL,
    assigned_story VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    assigned_reporter VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    status VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE assignment_schedules (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    assignee_id INT,
    assignment_date DATE,
    due_date DATE,
    story_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (assignee_id) REFERENCES editorial_calendars(id)
);

CREATE TABLE editorial_calendars (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    event_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    event_date DATE NOT NULL,
    assigned_to VARCHAR(100),
    status VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE assignment_schedules (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    assignment_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    deadline DATE NOT NULL,
    assigned_by VARCHAR(100),
    completed BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE
);

CREATE TABLE upcoming_stories (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    story_title VARCHAR(200) NOT NULL,
    story_description TEXT,
    story_deadline DATE,
    assigned_to VARCHAR(100),
    status VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE reporters (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    reporter_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE,
    phone_number VARCHAR(20),
    beat VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE editors (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    editor_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE,
    phone_number VARCHAR(20),
    department VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL
);
